Original_notes: settled [crossed out]; some may be less others more: see item #143 for my definition of a community
wood grave posts -> to mark or commemorate all persons [underlined] except very young infants
not now however
real property = wives; livestock, precious metals, slaves [crossed out]; cf. Hart-Pilling (1960)

only at funerals. "Workers" are hired (from designated kin groups in reference to deceased EGO[?]) to cut poles + perform services. Are not "specialists". Paid in kind (pre-contact days) + now in money + goods
?; mo-in-law + son-in-law contract = son in law "Feeds" m. in. l. (gives unlimited food + services + goods) for promised wife(s). Throughout life of m. or s. in law is a legal contract
No formal trade – rare resources (i.e. ochre deposits) can be mined by outsiders + an obligation results[?], but obligation unspecified
marriage classes, castes [..], men’s clubs, secret societies, warrior societies [..], craft guilds [crossed out]; (ceremonial teams) not permanent

"Big" men have many wives. But every male Tiwi has the expectation of becoming a Big man – although few may realize[?] it. They concive the society as one of equals (same as our conception of American society!)
"classes"; more land [crossed out]; wives
"classes"; or concubines [crossed out]
They may have a few more poles indicating that their kin group is larger + therefore can afford to hire more workers. But no significant difference in ceremony

This depends on definitions. The Tiwi tribe is not a political unit. 10 Countries make up the tribe – these are social + political units – continuous group. X – number of communities in each country are social and political units – generally continuous group. X – number of camps in each community are social and political units – not continuously grouped

a good fighter is remembered in name + deed + often song about which is high praise for the Tiwi + may bring him more wives i.e. status
they don’t fight over land

Every adult male tiwi is a bard, minstrel etc. = important + prestigeful activity. Some are better than others but all are expected to perform
